# Environment Variables Template for Render

## Required Variables (MUST be set)

```bash
# MongoDB Connection
MONGO_URI=mongodb+srv://username:password@cluster.mongodb.net/database_name

# Frontend URL (for CORS)
FRONTEND_URL=https://your-frontend-url.com
```

## Auto-Generated by Render

```bash
# JWT Secret (Render will auto-generate this)
JWT_SECRET_KEY=<auto-generated-by-render>

# Port (Render sets this automatically)
PORT=<set-by-render>
```

## Optional Email Configuration

```bash
# Email Server Settings
MAIL_SERVER=smtp.gmail.com
MAIL_PORT=587
MAIL_USE_TLS=true
MAIL_USERNAME=your-email@gmail.com
MAIL_PASSWORD=your-app-specific-password
MAIL_DEFAULT_SENDER=your-email@gmail.com
ADMIN_EMAIL=admin@outrecouture.com
```

## Application Settings (Pre-configured in render.yaml)

These are already set in render.yaml but can be overridden:

```bash
# Environment
PYTHON_VERSION=3.9.16
FLASK_ENV=production  # or development, staging
FLASK_DEBUG=false

# API Configuration
API_HOST=0.0.0.0
BASE_URL=https://your-service.onrender.com/api

# JWT Settings
JWT_EXPIRATION_HOURS=24
JWT_REFRESH_EXPIRATION_DAYS=7

# Security Settings
BCRYPT_ROUNDS=12
PASSWORD_MIN_LENGTH=8
MAX_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS=5
LOGIN_LOCKOUT_MINUTES=15
```

## How to Set in Render Dashboard

1. Go to your service in Render Dashboard
2. Click on "Environment" tab
3. Click "Add Environment Variable"
4. Enter key and value
5. Click "Save Changes"
6. Service will automatically redeploy

## Notes

- **Never commit .env files to Git** - they contain sensitive credentials
- The `.env` file is for local development only
- In Render, set variables through the dashboard
- Variables marked as `sync: false` in render.yaml must be set manually
- Use Gmail App Passwords (not regular password) for email
